intro: Tridactyle scottellii, commonly known as the Scottell's tridactyle, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
